author: DarkLite1
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
# install docker stable
Install-Module DockerMsftProvider
Install-Package Docker -ProviderName DockerMsftProvider

# uninstall
Uninstall-Package -name docker -Verbose

# install docker preview
Install-Module DockerProvider
Install-Package Docker -ProviderName DockerProvider -RequiredVersion preview
```

## Expected behavior

A correct installation of the preview version of Docker.

## Actual behavior

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\7-preview> Install-Package Docker -ProviderName DockerProvider -RequiredVersion preview
WARNING: Cannot bind argument to parameter 'version' because it is an empty string.
WARNING: Index was outside the bounds of the array.

The package(s) come(s) from a package source that is not marked as trusted.
Are you sure you want to install software from 'Docker'?
[Y] Yes  [A] Yes to All  [N] No  [L] No to All  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "N"): A
Install-Package: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
```

## Environment data

Windows Server 2016, `$PSVersionTable`:

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0-preview.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0-preview.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.14393
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
Unless there's a version that is just labelled `prerelease`, I don't think that's expected to work. `-RequiredVersion` expects a full version number.

If you just want the latest prerelease, you just need to supply the `-AllowPrereleaseVersions` switch, without specifying a `-RequiredVersion`. 🙂

title: Install-Package: Index was outside the bounds of the array.
